intro: Priestleya rotundifolia, commonly known as the rounded-leaf larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its basal rosette of rounded, velvety leaves and spikes of blue to purple flowers. The plant belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes many toxic species, and it contains various alkaloids that can be harmful to humans and animals. Priestleya rotundifolia typically grows in moist, meadow-like habitats at high elevations. Its botanical features make it an important component of alpine and subalpine ecosystems.
